dbdiffchecker

Class DbConn

  • java.lang.Object
    • dbdiffchecker.DbConn

  • public class DbConn
extends java.lang.Object
    DbConn establishes a connection with a MySQL database based on the password, username, port, host, and database provided.
    Since:
    9-6-17

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DbConn(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String host, java.lang.String port, java.lang.String database, java.lang.String type)
      DbConn initializes a DB_conn object by setting the instance variables and testing the database connection to make sure that the database can be reached.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeDatabaseConnection()
      closeDatabaseConnection closes the connection with the database.
      void establishDatabaseConnection()
      establishDatabaseConnection makes a connection with the database using the information from this object's constructor.

      getDatabaseName returns the name of the database that this Db_conn object is to connect to.

      getFirstSteps returns the first steps to be taken in order to run the SQL statements.

      getTableCreateStatement gets and returns the create statement of the specified table.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> getTableList()
      getTableList gets the tables, columns, and indices of the database.
      java.lang.String getViewCreateStatement(java.lang.String view)
      getViewCreateStatement gets and returns the create statement of the desired table.
      java.util.ArrayList<Views> getViews()
      getViews gets a list of views of that exist in the database.
      void runSequelStatement(java.lang.String sqlStatement)
      runSequelStatement takes an SQL statement, runs it, and returns a boolean value which is whether or not an error occurred while running the statement.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DbConn

        public DbConn(java.lang.String username,
              java.lang.String password,
              java.lang.String host,
              java.lang.String port,
              java.lang.String database,
              java.lang.String type)
       throws java.sql.SQLException
        DbConn initializes a DB_conn object by setting the instance variables and testing the database connection to make sure that the database can be reached.
        Parameters:
        username - is a String which isthe username of the MySQL account.
        password - is a String which is the password of the MySQL account.
        host - is a String which is the host of the MySQL account.
        port - is a String which is the port MySQL is running on.
        database - is a String which is the database in MySQL that the connection is to be established with.
        type - is a String which is to either dev or live.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - the database could not be connected to using the provided information.

    • Method Detail

      • getDatabaseName

        public java.lang.String getDatabaseName()
        getDatabaseName returns the name of the database that this Db_conn object is to connect to.
        Returns:
        db is a String which is the name of the database that this Db_conn object is to connect to.

      • getFirstSteps

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getFirstSteps()
        getFirstSteps returns the first steps to be taken in order to run the SQL statements. These SQL statements are used to drop Primary Keys and remove auto_increments on the database provided. Note: this funntion will return an empty ArrayList if the function is called on the dev database.
        Returns:
        firstSteps is an ArrayList of Strings which is the first steps to be taken in order to run the SQL statements

      • establishDatabaseConnection

        public void establishDatabaseConnection()
                                 throws DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException
        establishDatabaseConnection makes a connection with the database using the information from this object's constructor.
        Throws:
        DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException - a wrapper for the erro when connecting to the database
        See Also:
        https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e3gnhsGqNmI&t=158s

      • closeDatabaseConnection

        public void closeDatabaseConnection()
                             throws DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException
        closeDatabaseConnection closes the connection with the database.
        Throws:
        DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException

      • getTableCreateStatement

        public java.lang.String getTableCreateStatement(java.lang.String table)
                                         throws DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException
        getTableCreateStatement gets and returns the create statement of the specified table.
        Parameters:
        table - is a String which is the name of the table for which the create statement should be retrieved.
        Returns:
        a String which is the table's create statement or an empty string if an error occurred.
        Throws:
        DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException

      • getViewCreateStatement

        public java.lang.String getViewCreateStatement(java.lang.String view)
                                        throws DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException
        getViewCreateStatement gets and returns the create statement of the desired table.
        Parameters:
        view - is a String which is the name of the view for which the create statement should be retrieved.
        Returns:
        a String which is the view's create statement or an empty string if an error occurred.
        Throws:
        DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException

      • getTableList

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> getTableList()
                                                       throws DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException
        getTableList gets the tables, columns, and indices of the database.
        Returns:
        is a HashMap of String and Table object pairs which are the names of the tables and table data that exist in the database.
        Throws:
        DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException

      • getViews

        public java.util.ArrayList<Views> getViews()
                                    throws DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException
        getViews gets a list of views of that exist in the database.
        Returns:
        views is an ArrayList of Views which are all of the views in the database.

      • runSequelStatement

        public void runSequelStatement(java.lang.String sqlStatement)
